title: 4 Reasons Why Ticketmaster Won't Let You Sell a Ticket

steps.title: Some tickets are not available for resale.
steps.content: Some tickets are not available for resale. According to Ticketmaster, not all artists, teams, or venues allow ticket resale for certain rows, seats, or entire events. Unfortunately, there's no way to know if your tickets are eligible for resale before you purchase them. The only way to find out is to select your order in the My Events or My Tickets portion of your account, and then select Sell .

steps.title: You can't resell third-party resale tickets on Ticketmaster.
steps.content: You can't resell third-party resale tickets on Ticketmaster. If you purchased a third-party resale ticket on Ticketmaster, you can't resell that ticket on Ticketmaster if you change your mind. [1] X Research source Third-party resale tickets are also called verified resale tickets.

steps.title: You must provide some information to Ticketmaster before you can sell.
steps.content: You must provide some information to Ticketmaster before you can sell. If you haven't validated your seller information, Ticketmaster won't let you resell your tickets. To sell tickets you must do the following: Add a debit card or bank account to your Ticketmaster account Add a debit card or credit card (in case of refunds) Add your Social Security Number (SSN) or Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN)

steps.title: Ticketmaster only allows sales of tickets bought on Ticketmaster.
steps.content: Ticketmaster only allows sales of tickets bought on Ticketmaster. Unlike sites like SeatGeek or StubHub, you can't sell tickets you bought on another site on Ticketmaster.
